channel.title: Career Services Council
channel.description: Career Services Council master Calendar, includes CS offices using Webtools calendars for their events.

item.title: Faculty Job Search Retreat
item.description: Are you finishing your degree and going to be on the job market? Get valuable advice on your cover letters, CV, and more from faculty who have done it before! This afternoon seminar will include an overview of the application process, a question and answer session, and roundtables on topics like teaching statements, cover letters, research statements, and more! Join the Graduate College Career Development Office, a panel of faculty experts, and others from around campus for the annual Faculty Job Search Retreat. For more information, visit the Graduate College website.

item.title: Career Exploration Group
item.description:
The Career Exploration Group provides a guided discovery process and collaborative environment for graduate students who are changing their career plans. Participants will work with career advisors to identify new career options that fit their skills, interests and values. They will also learn about resources for job searching and begin the process of developing effective application materials.

Participants commit to meeting once a week for 4 weeks, with 1-1.5 hours/week of additional work. The Summer 2015 Career Exploration Group will meet Thursdays from 12:00-1:00pm, starting June 25 and ending July 16. All sessions will be held in 304 Coble Hall.

Register by June 23 to participate.

item.title: Staying Organized on the Job Market
